etymology.description: Depicts leather being twisted or tanned
etymology.interpretation: The character 韋(韋) (wéi, 'soft leather') visually represents a process in leatherworking, such as twisting or tanning, which softens the tough material.

examples.chinese: 这种韋皮手感细腻(這種韋皮手感細膩)，更适合制作高档家具(更適合製作高檔家具)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng wěi pí shǒu gǎn xì nì, gèng shì hé zhì zuò gāo dàng jiā jù.
examples.english: This kind of soft leather has a delicate texture and is more suitable for making high-end furniture.

examples.chinese: 博物馆展出了许多用韋制成的文物(博物館展出了許多用韋制成的文物)，吸引了众多游客(吸引了眾多遊客)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn zhǎnchūle xǔduō yòng wěi zhìchéng de wénwù, xīyǐnle zhòngduō yóukè.
examples.english: The museum exhibited numerous artifacts made of soft leather, attracting many visitors.
